text.0: priest of our rite stand up erect o agni in the gods service best of sacrificers.
text.1: for over evei y thought thou art the ruler thou furtherest een the wisdom of the pious.
text.2: he was set down mid men as priest unerring agni wise welcome in our holy synods.
text.3: like savitar he hath lifted up his splendour and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.
text.4: the glowing ladle filled with oil is lifted choosing gods service to the right he circles.
text.5: eager he rises like the newwrought pillar which firmly set and fixed anoints the victims.
text.6: when sacred grass is strewn and agni kindled the adhvaryu rises to his task rejoicing.
text.7: agni the priest like one who tends the cattle goes three times round as from of old he wills it.
text.8: agni himself the priest with measured motion goes round with sweet speech cheerful true to order.
text.9: his fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.
text.10: beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect o lovely agni terrible when spreading.
text.11: thy splendours are not covered by the darkness detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.
text.12: naught hindered his production bounteous giver his mother and his sire were free to send him.
text.13: then as friend benevolent refulgent agni shone forth in human habitations.
text.14: he agni whom the twicefive sisters dwelling together in the homes of men engendered.
text.15: bright like a spears tooth wakened in the morning with powerful mouth and like an axe wellsharpened.
text.16: these thy bay coursers agni dropping fatness ruddy vigorous speeding straightly forward.
text.17: and red steeds wonderful of mighty muscle are to this service of the gods invited.
text.18: these brightlyshining games of thine o agni that move for ever restless allsubduing.
text.19: like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry roar loudly like the army of the maruts.
text.20: to thee o flaming god hath prayer been offered let the priest laud thee give to him who worships.
text.21: men have established agni as invoker fain to adore the glory of the living.
